page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: In{1086 the manor of Deerhurst}was owned by St. Peter's Church of Westminster & comprised 59 hides. Some 34 people lived in the hundred. The Saxon church still attracts visiters to the area but symbolically the priory has been converted to farm buildings and the school has moved from Deerhurst to{Apperley}which is a village experiencing rapid residential growth. In the{1981 census}763 people lived in the parish and of 272 dwellings 65% were owner-occupied. Unemployment was only 3.8%. Significantly 86% of the households own one or more cars. It is thus an area split in two: physically by the River Severn and culturally by the influx of residents who regard the area as a rural dormitory. This area can only be studied as it relates to neighbouring towns.
